name: Mahler's 3/2 problem
summary:
In mathematics, Mahler's 3/2 problem concerns the existence of "Z-numbers".
A Z-number is a nonzero real number x such that the  fractional parts of

  
    
      
        x
        
          
            (
            
              
                3
                2
              
            
            )
          
          
            n
          
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle x\left({\frac {3}{2}}\right)^{n}}
  

are less than 1/2 for all positive integers n.  Kurt Mahler
